result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant does not appear and did not appear back on May 10th.
BTC: Bench warrant and bond forfeiture authorized and stayed 48 hours.

records.addlTxt: from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

3:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Franco Naum Jimenez Arellano appeared in court, Attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger appeared in court for Franco Naum Jimenez Arellano. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez. Sworn in previously.
BTC: Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2022 at 09:45 am.
